text: More Pelosi: "The Attorney General’s offer to provide the Committees with a summary of the report’s conclusions is insufficient. Congress requires the full report and the underlying documents so that the Committees can proceed with their independent work."
author: mmcauliff

text: More Pelosi: Pelosi: "We are insisting that any briefings to any Committees be unclassified so that Members can speak freely about every aspect of the report and not be confined to what DOJ chooses to release publicly."
author: mmcauliff

text: Pelosi to members of Congress: "Today, we are having an emergency Caucus conference call at 3:00 p.m. E.T. to discuss the transmittal of the Mueller report to the Department of Justice (DOJ)."
author: mmcauliff

text: Completely worth reading this for the broad sweep of what we actually know about the Russian investigation.
author: mmcauliff

text: R calling for Mueller report to be public soon.
author: mmcauliff

text: Key from Nadler et al: "Because the Justice Department maintains that a sitting president cannot be indicted, to then withhold evidence of wrongdoing from Congress because a sitting President cannot be charged is to convert Justice Department policy into the means for a cover-up"
author: mmcauliff

text: From @RepJerryNadler and other House chairs: “After nearly two years of investigation- accompanied by two years of unprecedented attacks on the integrity of the investigation by President Trump- the public and Congress are entitled to know what the Special Counsel has found."
author: mmcauliff

text: Chairwoman who controls spending bills, otherwise known as the purse strings.
author: mmcauliff

text: worthwhile perspective here
author: mmcauliff

text: "the American public deserve to fully know Trump’s involvement with Russia."
author: mmcauliff

text: Harris weighs in
author: mmcauliff

text: A bit more from the statement Deutch released: "Make no mistake, this is only the first step. The Attorney General should make the report public and let the American people learn the facts Mueller uncovered... "Our mission to get to the truth is not over."
author: mmcauliff

text: If anyone thought Mueller wrapping up would wrap it...
author: mmcauliff

text: And Pelosi and Schumer: "it is imperative for Mr. Barr to make the full report public and provide its underlying documentation and findings to Congress.  Attorney General Barr must not give President Trump, his lawyers or his staff any ‘sneak preview’"
author: mmcauliff

text: McConnell is the first leader out: "Many Republicans have long believed that Russia poses a significant threat to American interests. I hope the Special Counsel’s report will help inform and improve our efforts to protect our democracy."
author: mmcauliff

text: Sen. Chris Murphy out of the gate with a Mueller statement: “Attorney General Barr should immediately turn over all records to Congress and make the full Special Counsel’s report public."
author: mmcauliff

text: And now we wait some more. How much will Barr release?
author: mmcauliff

text: AOC liked an innocuous comment I made about staff work the other day, and still it is swarmed by bots. Those bots will be used for something, eventually.
author: mmcauliff

text: This seems like an enormous business opportunity for lefty consultants.
author: mmcauliff

text: Nadler, @HouseJudiciary want to haul Scott Lloyd back in to find out why he said he wasn't tracking separated migrant girls' menstrual cycles when it turns out he was, not to mention pushing girls to not get abortions. https://judiciary.house.gov/sites/democrats.judiciary.house.gov/files/documents/Scott%20Lloyd%203.22.19.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: So, Jared Kushner was talking to foreign leaders on WhatsApp. Cool, but what about her emails? Elijah Cummings: https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2019-03-21.EEC%20to%20Cipollone-WH.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: Indeed, that’s what staff does. Having watched hearings for more than a decade, the oversight committee staff is especially good at it.
author: mmcauliff

text: “The American people should be able to trust that government officials are working for them – not for big defense contractors,” said Warren.
author: mmcauliff

text: Why mightn’t you want a former exec of a major defense contractor running the DoD? Per @ewarren, the DoD inspector general is investigating her report that acting Secy Shanahan tools steps to help Boeing, his former company
author: mmcauliff

text: Cc Neera Tanden
author: mmcauliff

text: This is the first step in at least compiling a public record of the Trump probes so even if Mueller’s report is not released by DoJ, the House will have its own material. The Judiciary Committee is also where any impeachment would start, even if Pelosi isn’t inclined to go there.
author: mmcauliff

text: Jerry Nadler says the Judiciary Committee has gotten 10s of thousands of documents from the 81 requests they sent out to people in various Trump probes.
author: mmcauliff

text: Specifically, the people who least often say they have no opinion or haven't heard of AOC are Republicans and conservatives, i.e. Fox watchers. Those least likely to have heard of her and have opinions are non-whites and younger people- not Fox watchers.
author: mmcauliff

text: Beyond Cheney's simple support for the 9/11 bill, it also sends a strong signal to other conservatives that this an American issue, not some New York thing. Said @RepPeteKing: “When you have somebody like Liz Cheney on the bill, it becomes the embodiment of it.”
author: mmcauliff

text: Liz Cheney is signing on to the 9/11 bill. It's a big deal to responders because lots of them are very conservative. She's not only conservative, she's the highest-ranking Republican supporter so far.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Rep. @Ilhan on New Zealand, and a call to avoid Friday prayers: 
"I said to people that is what the terrorists want us to do, that is what is a win for them. And so we must face the hate and terror with love and with compassion."
author: mmcauliff

text: Pretty simple message from the kids rallying at the #Climatestrike on Capitol Hill soon.
author: mmcauliff

text: @LeaderHoyer on Christchurch "I pray that this heinous act of terror will instead achieve the opposite of its goal and become an opportunity for all people to draw closer as fellow men and women in a spirit of brotherhood and acceptance.”
author: mmcauliff

text: There are Ronald Reagan icons all over this video, and the guy’s big slam is that AOC is an actor.
author: mmcauliff

text: Wilbur Ross tried to run out the clock on @AOC. It didn't go so well for him or Republicans who professed confusion on her question.
author: mmcauliff

text: Seriously, Ross tried telling members "you're out of time" repeatedly to duck questions. I hadn't seen that until Matt Whitaker a few weeks back. I guess it's a thing now.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Elijah Cummings tells Wilbur Ross to hand over information he declined to provide in today's hearing citing "confidentiality" and ongoing Census litigation, or "You will basically be forcing us to consider a subpoena."
author: mmcauliff

text: @aoc calls out Ross's continued insistence that he added a citizenship question at the request of the DoJ. "It has nothing to do with the DoJ, it has nothing to do with the Voting Rights Act. It is about congressional apportionment to immigrants."
author: mmcauliff

text: Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.), with implicit criticism of Republicans in rejecting Trump's emergency resolution. "Today's vote will not fix any problem, but it does demonstrate whether a senator supports or opposes border security."
author: mmcauliff

text:
Rep. Green to Wilber Ross:
"Have you ever lied before Congress?"

Ross: "No, sir."
author: mmcauliff

text: The senate is just 8 senators shy of being able to override
author: mmcauliff

text:
Rs Voting against Trump's wall declaration:
Alexander
Blunt
Collins
Lee
Moran
Murkowski
Paul
Portman
Romney
Rubio
Toomey
Wicker
author: mmcauliff

text: Wilbur Ross says he doesn't recall telling his deputy, Earl Comstock, that  he was interested in a citizenship question soon after his confirmation. That contradicts testimony Rep. Jackie Speier read to Ross.
author: mmcauliff

text: Ross answers Rep. Lynch's question about documents related to transfers of tech to Saudi Arabia, and Ross answers about documents related to the Census. Mark Meadows had to step in to clarify.
author: mmcauliff

text: Wilbur Ross tells Gerry Connolly he doesn't think adding the citizenship question is an "extreme modification. This was restoring a question that had been asked many times before." Connolly notes the question hasn't been on the decennial Census since 1950.
author: mmcauliff

text: Portman will vote against Trump's declaration. I believe that makes 10 Rs. Says Trump will veto and "his veto will be sustained."
author: mmcauliff

text: Portman adds that "the president has available to him enough funds right now to begin building all the barriers he has requested without resorting to national emergency funds."
author: mmcauliff

text: Sen. Portman: “Future presidents could actually use this authority, the emergency authority, to tear down the very wall  we are now constructing. And some Democrats running for president have said that’s what they intend to do.”
author: mmcauliff

text: But what did OMB use to come up with numbers? Maybe Ross only gets personally involved in specific details that matter to the administration, like the citizenship question?
author: mmcauliff

text: Ross says he had no input into President Trump's budget request for the Census (!!)
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Miller is reminding Wilbur Ross how many programs depend on Census data, including things like funding school lunches. But somehow she misses the point made by advocates and courts that the citizenship question lowers the accuracy of the Census.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Plaskett notes estimate that adding citizenship question will cost $27 million, and court finding that many people will still go uncounted. "Why would you want to include the cost for that question?"

"I have nothing to say," Ross said.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Plaskett pushed back on Rep. Gosar, who lauded Ross for following in the tradition of Thomas Jefferson. Plaskett noted that Jefferson favored counting slaves as 3/5's of a person, says she's not sure Jefferson should be the litmus test for the Census now.
author: mmcauliff

text: Again, reminded by @RepRaskin of the administrative law findings that the citizenship question was added based on a pretext, Ross won't say yes or no, only points back to his announcement.
author: mmcauliff

text: I'll been interested in @aoc's questions later!
author: mmcauliff

text:
Clay: "Mr Secretary, you lied to Congress."

"You should resign."

Ross: "Is there a question in that?"
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Clay played video of all the times Wilbur Ross toll Congress he added the citizenship question at the request of the Justice Department.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Virginia Foxx (R-N.C.) is upset that "illegal immigrants" are counted the same -- "counted the same!" -- as citizens.
author: mmcauliff

text: DeSaulnier asks if Ross is responsible for delivering documents. Ross says he'll discuss it with his staff.
author: mmcauliff

text: Ross also says he does not have a recollection of a memo that was hand-delivered to the Justice Dept. on the citizenship question well before the DoJ asked for one.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. DeSaulnier asks Ross why he requested on a memo on the citizenship question in Aug. 2017. Ross says he needs to have his memory refreshed, then doesn't answer, saying DeSaulnier asked a very broad question.
author: mmcauliff

text: He offered a loophole for himself -- that he answered truthfully based on how he understood the questions.
author: mmcauliff

text: Ross is mostly dodging Cummings' questions on whether Ross told the truth, sticking with repeating processes.
author: mmcauliff

text: Cummings notes Ross was looking at the citizenship Q  9 months before he got a request from the DoJ. Ross says he was just looking for information, among lots of other questions.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Cummings: You do not wish to withdraw your testimony?

Ross: I testified truthfully based on my understanding of the questions
author: mmcauliff

text: Asked if Ross added the citizenship question "solely" because of a request from DoJ, Ross doesn't answer directly, and recounts his statements of process.
author: mmcauliff

text: Elijah Cummings tells Wilbur Ross his approach is to give witnesses an opportunity to come clean, to tell the trough.
author: mmcauliff

text: Wilbur Ross is arguing now that - despite lawsuit evidence showing him pushing a citizenship question on the Census - he was getting prepared in case the DoJ wanted a citizenship question.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Love local paper captions
https://www.elpasotimes.com/story/news/2019/03/14/beto-2020-orourke-presidential-campaign-challenges-trump-border-wall/3013306002/ …
author: mmcauliff

text: Gotta give the local paper the click!
author: mmcauliff

text: Does she have a cool dog and a pickup?
author: mmcauliff

text: And there's not just jail time for Manafort. Buh-bye to that Brooklyn brownstone and other properties.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Trump rejects Mike Lee's National Emergency bill. Lee says he will reject Trump's national wall emergency.
"Unfortunately, it appears the bill does not have an immediate path forward, so I will be voting to terminate the latest emergency declaration."
author: mmcauliff

text: Confirmed. This preserves the president's future ability to declare emergencies, but isn't going to help him avoid an embarrassing rejection tomorrow.
author: mmcauliff

text: "Climate change is real and requires real solutions, but the Democrat Party has accepted this economy destroying new deal as a new commandment.. but for most Americans this plan is a declaration of war on the economy."
author: mmcauliff

text: Sen. Rick Scott on @aoc and #GreenNewDeal "Here's the problem. A socialist from New York City with a massive Twitter following introduced this non-serious plan and every single major Democrat running for president immediately embraced it. Let that sink in for a moment."
author: mmcauliff

text: Pelosi: "Chuck is on the way. (laughter)"
author: mmcauliff

text: McConnell keeps up his Green New Deal floor speeches: "Our Democratic colleagues have taken all the debunked philosophies of the last 100 years rolled them into one giant package, and thrown a little green paint on them."
author: mmcauliff

text:
One of the companies that @AOC mentioned in her "caging of children" questions to Wells Fargo takes exception. 

"This is a deliberate lie driven by an agenda aimed at abolishing ICE," says a GEO Group spokesman.
author: mmcauliff

text:
Congressional salaries are set by law. She could probably donate anything over $80,000, but I don't think it's possible to cap it.
https://fas.org/sgp/crs/misc/97-1011.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: @AOC raised big questions today about banks' responsibility for harm enabled by their investments. But maybe the staff work on particulars with Wells Fargo was not the best this time, unlike her grilling of Michael Cohen. Curious what others think
author: mmcauliff

text: Sign fail at Wells Fargo hearing.
author: mmcauliff

text: Sloan now says he appreciates that Reps were referring to the NYT story, says he rejects the Times' conclusions. "The statements in the New York times are just wrong."
author: mmcauliff

text: Hi, @JenniferDunnWF. Thanks for following me. (Maybe off that @RepGregoryMeeks tweet?) At least it shows you do pay attention to media. Did you guys not brief the CEO on the New York Times story?
author: mmcauliff

text: Wells Fargo CEO Sloan tells @RepGregoryMeeks he is unfamiliar with a NYT story that says the incentives, targets that led to all those fake accounts is alive and well in the debt collection dept. Hard to believe Sloan's staff didn't show him this:
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Andy Barr (R-Ky.) tells the CEO of Wells Fargo he's angry because Wells Fargo makes other look bad.
author: mmcauliff

text: And Pelosi: “The cruel and shortsighted cuts in President Trump’s budget request are a roadmap to a sicker, weaker America.  House Democrats will reject this toxic, destructive budget request"
author: mmcauliff

text: Actually seems a little slow if the president is talking about cutting $845 billion from Medicare.
author: mmcauliff

text:
The centrist Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget says Trump's budget request is "full of accounting gimmicks" that mean his $7.8 trillion in borrowing over 10 years "would be closer to $10.5 trillion" under more reasonable scenarios.
cc budget hawks in Congress.
author: mmcauliff

text: Similarly, Majority @LeaderHoyer says "The President’s Fiscal Year 2020 budget released this morning reflects the Trump Administration’s separation from reality." He also notes the wall money, and a repeal of the ACA.
author: mmcauliff

text: Approps Chair @NitaLowey on the budget request: "President Trump has somehow managed to produce a budget request even more untethered from reality than his past two." Says that's underscored by inclusion fo $8.6 billion for the wall.
author: mmcauliff

text: —> Top $$ appropriator in the House
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer and Pelosi on Trump’s new wall $$ request: “Congress refused to fund his wall and he was forced to admit defeat and reopen the government. The same thing will repeat itself if he tries this again. We hope he learned his lesson.”
author: mmcauliff

text: The Census is an enormous job that is generally underfunded. Yet, here I get the “thank you” for responding to the ACS and please respond to the ACS letters mailed on the same day.
author: mmcauliff

text: A genuinely good moment today. @RodneyDavis recognizing that @RepDebHaaland becomes the first Native American to preside over Congress.
author: mmcauliff

text: Because they steal an hour of sleep this week, we're well aware. but thanks.
author: mmcauliff

text: Steny Hoyer reminds Steve Scalise, who was objecting that yesterday's resolution wasn't direct enough about anti-Semitism, that his side's house is made of glass. "I'm not going to cite some of the remarks of the minority leader with respect to Mr. Soros..."
author: mmcauliff

text: In other words, Congress is stealing back the hard-won morning light that I woke to today, and plunging my mornings back into darkness for another month.
author: mmcauliff

text: For context, San Francisco signed up like 49 migrants to vote. (they can't vote in federal elections.)
author: mmcauliff

text: More Rep. Dan Crenshaw: "The city of San Francisco has effectively cancelled out the votes of its citizens and replaced it with illegals. When I say it out loud, it sounds like I'm making it up."
author: mmcauliff

text: In support, Rep. Dan Crenshaw says, "our vote should mean something.. and we should know that when we cast it, it is sacred and untainted."
author: mmcauliff

text: Sounds about right. Think of Rep. Jefferson, who also lived an otherwise blameless life. Same judge gave him 13 yrs for a $100K bribe. Maybe if he swapped it for ostrich coats instead of sticking it in his freezer, he'd have just gotten a few weeks.
author: mmcauliff

text: Zoe Lofgren, with a jab at Mitch McConnell's description of HR1 as "power grab." "Yes it is," she said. "A power grab for the people."
author: mmcauliff

text: With dust settling on the anti-bigotry vote, consider, it's really not settled. Many old-line Ds wanted an anti-Semitism vote. Hoyer spent much of his speech on it. @RepEliotEngel was publicly bitter. And Mitch McConnell pledged to keep picking at it.
author: mmcauliff

text: I have Serrano and Jeffries saying much the same. Also worth noting; even though she walked it back a bit, Maloney said on the record she’s not supporting Gillibrand.
author: mmcauliff

text: This from Dem @RepMaxRose: “For those who have magically found their strength to tackle bigotry in our country, I would remind them it doesn’t take courage to condemn hate in another party, but it takes character to stand up to your own”
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Doug Collins (R-Ga.), disdaining the entire process around the anti-hatred resolution: "We don’t need a manual to tell us who we can’t hate."
author: mmcauliff

text: House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy thanks Rep. Eliot Engel (D-Bronx) for his remarks saying the House should be voting on a straight resolution condemning anti-Semitism.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Eliot Engel says he'll vote for the anti-bigotry resolution, but he's not forgiving Ilhan Omar. "I am very disappointed" that we didn't have a separate resolution to single out the anti-Semitism and the remarks of Omar.
author: mmcauliff

text: The irony of this Democratic resolution on the House floor right now is it sounds a little bit like all lives matter.
author: mmcauliff

text: Alito and Kagan just explained to Congress, minutes ago, that cameras would still be bad in SCOTUS. So, I guess it's a judge thing.
author: mmcauliff

text: Pelosi, onIlhan Omar's remarks: "I don't think that the congresswoman perhaps appreciates the full weight of how it's heard by other people, although I don't believe it was intended in an anti-Semitic way... we have to remove all doubt."
author: mmcauliff

text: At hearing on immigration courts, @RepJoseSerrano says Justice Dept leaders have "attempted to turn our immigration courts into a sort of deportation DMV– where immigrants get minimal due process on their way out the door."
author: mmcauliff

text: McConnell pans Pelosi and her "far left" majority for not voting on the Ilhan Omar-sparked anti-Semitism resolution. "Even a symbolic - symbolic - resolution condemning anti-Semitism seems to be a bridge too far."
author: mmcauliff

text: Cc @Jere_Hester
author: mmcauliff

text: In NY, ICE tracked protests. In San Diego, ICE, CBP et al compiled dossiers on lawyers, advocates, journalists. Flagged them for extra screening, and stopped some from entering Mexico to cover the migrant crisis. Per NBC San Diego. https://www.nbcsandiego.com/investigations/Source-Leaked-Documents-Show-the-US-Government-Tracking-Journalists-and-Advocates-Through-a-Secret-Database-506783231.html …
author: mmcauliff

text: I just learned this very morning that ICE put a rally in Manhattan against anti-semitism, hosted by a congressman, on an anti-Trump threat list.
author: mmcauliff

text: Steve Scalise, on Ilan Omar
author: mmcauliff

text:
Bennie Thompson: I just want you to admit they're cages

Secy Nielsen: They're not cages.
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Clay Higgins (R-La.) compares migrants crossing the border to D-Day. It's more than a D-Day every month, he says.
author: mmcauliff

text: The Green New Deal picks up Bill Pascrell (D-N.J.)
author: mmcauliff

text: cc @RepYvetteClarke @RepKathleenRice @RepMaxRose , who have DHS Secy in front of their committee in a few minutes...
author: mmcauliff

text: Why is ICE monitoring political events, let alone tracking a congressman's rally against white supremacist anti-Semites?
author: mmcauliff

text: re the Hillary not running report
author: mmcauliff

text: Too depressing.
author: mmcauliff

text: Read your story, wanted to see it. Easy clip!
author: mmcauliff

text: The federal workforce has taken a beating lately- shutdowns, sequestration, vilification. Passing a bill for 12 weeks of family leave may help. @RepMaloney: "Paid family leave improves productivity, reduces turnover, boosts morale and attracts and retains more talent."
author: mmcauliff

text: And yes, there is a story that goes with that, since we chatted with Nadler this morning after Trump posted his "stone cold CRAZY" tweets.
author: mmcauliff

text: Congressional Dem ( Jerry Nadler) on Trump: "He has to get used to the fact that now we have a Congress that’s going to do our job."
author: mmcauliff

text: I was so sure that was going to go on to datadumbasses.
author: mmcauliff
mmcauliff

text: More Rose: "After our city and country were attacked we were very clear with the Taliban—either they give up Osama bin Laden and al Qaeda, or we would come and get them ourselves. They chose to protect Osama Bin Laden, and they rightfully paid the price."
author: mmcauliff

text: Max Rose: “I believe it's long past time we end the war in Afghanistan, but I strongly disagree with the idea that the invasion was wrong on moral or national security grounds.”
author: mmcauliff

text: Staten Island @RepMaxRose, who is a member of @AOC's generation and fought in Afghanistan, had a thoughtful take on her argument that Congress' 9/11 Afghanistan vote in 2001 "led my generation into a disastrous + wrong war."
author: mmcauliff

text: interesting question and answer
author: mmcauliff

text: Alt hed: McConnell scores funding for govt-run/owned healthcare for former workers of govt-owned military; denounces socialism.
author: mmcauliff

text: I think you meant it's raining docuMENt requests
author: mmcauliff

text: Now Democrats (Schiff, Cummings, Engel) are demanding docs and interviews from the White House and State Dept. re Trump's communications with Putin. https://intelligence.house.gov/uploadedfiles/03-04-19_engel-cummings-schiff-letter-to-mick-mulvaney-requesting-white-house-putin-interview-documents.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: Jon Stewart really does think Team Trump is going a good job with the 9/11 victim fund. He told me again last night after Trump tweeted about it. But Stewart wants more: support for victims about to see the fund slashed.
author: mmcauliff

text: After President Trump retweeted Jon Stewart’s praise tonight, I reach out to Stewart and he says he’s standing by it. http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/ny-pol-stewart-trump-praise-20190303-story.html …
author: mmcauliff

text: You know what they say. It's all about the echolocation
author: mmcauliff

text: Nice story, tho I've always been partial to First Laddy
author: mmcauliff

text: Rep. Elijah Cummings, whose @OversightDems was already probing WH security clearances is not pleased with the NYT report that Trump leaned on officials for Jared, and had already sought details. "It may become necessary to consider alternative means to compel compliance."
author: mmcauliff

text: Re Lynne Patton, NY/NJ HUD administrator, skipping a conference to be a prop for Mark Meadows saying Trump is not racist.
author: mmcauliff

text:
but  but 
that says 2 million fewer refunds
and $4 billion less to taxpayers
author: mmcauliff

text: Looks like the RNC is also impressed with Cummings’ handling of its former deputy finance chair
author: mmcauliff

text: Bethesda, Md. native, raised in Va. That "darlin'" expression is a recent vintage.
author: mmcauliff

text: Remember those amazing claims out of Texas of thousands and thousands of illegal voters? Read this...
author: mmcauliff

text: Cohen kinda dunked on Jim Jordan here.
author: mmcauliff

text: Some more about Mark Meadows, R-N.C., Freedom Caucus chair, thinking 9/11 is NY's problem. There are 1,006 North Carolinians registered in the victims compensation fund. 306 have gotten payouts. Meadows has 40 constituents in the 9/11 treatment program. Are they NY's problem?
author: mmcauliff

text:
Mark Meadows' suggestion to ill firefighters that 9/11 is a New York problem does not sit well with Pete King. 

"Anyone who does not believe it’s an American issue does not understand what it means to be an American."
author: mmcauliff

text: While Mark Meadows suggested to a firefighter in a wheelchair that 9/11 is a New York problem, he tweeted this last September:
author: mmcauliff

text: Mark Meadows, head of the Freedom Caucus, suggested to ill firefighters that really New York should be doing more about 9/11. They reminded him of Pearl Harbor. https://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/ny-pol-pete-king-911-victim-compensation-mark-meadows-freedom-caucus-fund-20190226-story.html …
author: mmcauliff

text: The House has a hearing today on the administration's unaccompanied minor policy. The president of the American Psychiatric Association's testimony is titled: Reviewing the Administration's Unaccompanied Children Program: State-Sanctioned Child Abuse https://docs.house.gov/meetings/AP/AP07/20190227/108960/HHRG-116-AP07-Wstate-StewartA-20190227.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: I didn't realize NY was so lousy with anti-vaxxers. NIH's Anthony Fauci mentions three measles outbreaks in the state in 2019 (of 6 nationwide) in his testimony at the Energy and Commerce Committee tomorrow.
author: mmcauliff

text: Missed this amid the rush of news today: @RepJeffries and Rep. Steve Chabot are getting the words "Eskimo," "Oriental," and "Negro" stricken from federal code.
author: mmcauliff

text: Gotta hand it to Amash for ideological consistency.
author: mmcauliff

text: Really local, but a big deal for a freshman Dem facing 2020 in Trump Country- Staten Island Rep. Max Rose got his bill passed to finally build a sea wall to shield thousands from another superstorm.
author: mmcauliff

text: There are so many more. These people are why Jon Stewart came to DC yesterday. As much as we in the press focus on the celebrity, they are ones who are still walking the halls, telling their stories, and trying to get Congress to move, yet again. None of them hesitated to move.
author: mmcauliff

text: Retired Det. Lou Alvarez finished his 63rd round of chemo before coming to DC. He has his pension and payout. He has to sit out some of the office visits because of exhaustion. He came for others. "This is money that they need for their families."
author: mmcauliff

text: Tresa Roth's husband was on the FBI's Evidence Response Team that dug through the Pentagon. He died of cancer in 2008, but it was only a few years ago that the government ruled his death line-of-duty. The delay means Roth gets half what others did.
author: mmcauliff

text: Anne Marie Principe beat brain cancer in 2005. She still has trouble breathing, and she's fighting breast cancer. She became an advocate after the military zone around Ground Zero sealed off her business.
author: mmcauliff

text: Richard Roeill answered 9/11 as a volunteer firefighter after he saw the planes hit. One of his lungs is collapsed. He's visiting congressional offices carrying his oxygen with him. They cluster his visits so he can make them.
author: mmcauliff

text: Jon Stewart is gone today, but there are still dozens of responders on Capitol Hill, like Rob Serra. His first day as a firefighter was 9/11. He was 21. He's in a wheelchair now. He's covered, but wants all the people getting sick now to have the same.
author: mmcauliff

text: Jon Stewart was "baffled," too, but pointed to a culprit: "Mitch McConnell has made this a problem. Only him. And I put the blame and the onus on him because he could fix it tomorrow... this would be done. And none of these people would have to be here."
author: mmcauliff

text: The question no one could answer on Capitol Hill today: Why can't Congress just pass the final 9/11 bill to ease the pain of 9/11 responders and victims?
author: mmcauliff

text: Thanks, Steve.
author: mmcauliff

text: Jon Stewart, John Feal on the Hill. Hoping to get the attention of a Congress that has been slow to act on 9/11 legislation.
author: mmcauliff

text: Stewart comes to DC for responders because they matter to him, and he brings a spotlight. But watching ill heroes go begging in 2015 for him was "between let’s say, eating ice cream in a lounge chair at a Knicks game versus hell, it tilted more toward the hell side.”
author: mmcauliff

text: Jon Stewart is back on the Hill today for 9/11 responders, but thinks it's "unreal" he has to be. He explained why here.
author: mmcauliff

text: Which process? Trump's or Congress's?
author: mmcauliff

text: The 9/11 fund is running out of money. For Tresa Roth it means her FBI agent husband's life will be valued at half. The death or suffering of thousands of others will be worth 30% or nothing. It's a slow-moving mass murder only Congress can ease.
author: mmcauliff

text: Interesting Appropriations isn't on that letter. As Commerce, Justice, Science chair Jose Serrano explained, they're looking for ways to compel this with the power of the purse.
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer casts Trump's Title X gag rule in the broader context of "systematic healthcare sabotage."
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer: Trump's emergency declaration "will fundamentally change the balance of powers in a way our country’s founders never envisioned."
author: mmcauliff

text: If this is the track record, via Vox, she sounds like a Republican. The few interactions I had with her, she was a run of the mill R. https://www.vox.com/2019/2/19/18231993/cnn-gop-operative-2020-election-coverage … And now I'm seeing she's not THE editor. She's an editor, answering to @DavidChalian.
author: mmcauliff

text: I've only heard good things about Caitlin. The main difference here seems to depend on personality and a Trump connection. If Sarah Isgur Flores' past political experience is an issue, so should it be for Caitlin, George Stephanopoulos and lots of others.
author: mmcauliff

text: I don't have a problem with her. But it's not years, according to that. Goes Rubio to CBS PR to CBS Political Director. How big a difference is it that Isgur isn't flakking for CNN first?
author: mmcauliff

text: it does.
author: mmcauliff

text: Elizabeth Warren is "poca warren." Not too hard to figure out where he got that nickname. https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/5745084/Hasson-Detention-Memo.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: Lots of NYers on the Maryland racist's alleged hit list: Gillibrand, Schumer, AOC, and lots of media people.
author: mmcauliff

text: Pelosi: Rep. Castro's resolution to end Trump's wall emergency will be introed Friday. "The President’s decision to go outside the bounds of the law to try to get what he failed to achieve in the constitutional legislative process violates the Constitution and must be terminated"
author: mmcauliff

text:
Michael Cohen Congressional testimony is back on for Feb. 27.

Rep. Elijah Cummings: “I am pleased to announce that Michael Cohen’s public testimony before the Oversight Committee is back on, despite efforts by some to intimidate his family members and prevent him from appearing”
author: mmcauliff

text: I wouldn’t expect an endorsement out of this, but the body language, between the lines will be interesting. And it’s Gillibrand turf.
author: mmcauliff

text: Remember how Congress stopped Obama from closing Gitmo with spending bill riders?Jose Serrano, whose subcommittee funds DoJ, intends to do the same thing for Mueller and his report on Trump and Russia. https://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/ny-pol-serrano-mueller-probe-20190216-story.html …
author: mmcauliff

text: A certain Puerto Rican from the Bronx has a plan to protect Mueller and release his Trump report. No, not her -- the guy who chairs the subcommittee that funds the Justice Department - @RepJoseSerrano  https://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/ny-pol-serrano-mueller-probe-20190216-story.html …
author: mmcauliff

text: Ah. Oversight Committee says Trumps lawyers repeatedly gave false info about payments to Michael Cohen to cover the alleged affairs. https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/OGE%20Docs_RESCANNED%20Redactions-compressed.pdf …
author: mmcauliff

text: The cuts to the 9/11 compensation fund are going to be brutal. 50% to 70%, unless Congress does something about it.
author: mmcauliff

text: Not just Congress can sue.  Dem AGs: “We will not hesitate to use our legal authority to defend the rule of law, as we did in our previous lawsuits, such as protecting DACA recipients and standing up against the President’s attempts to separate children from their families.”
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer: "Declaring a national emergency would be a lawless act, a gross abuse of the power of the presidency and a desperate attempt to distract form the fact that President Trump broke his core promise to have Mexico pay for the wall."
author: mmcauliff

text: @LeaderHoyer on an emergency declaration: "I was at our southern border last week and can verify that no emergency exists there. This is a dangerous ploy by a president who cares not a whit about the precedent it will set and the broad, bipartisan opposition in Congress."
author: mmcauliff

text: Interesting.
author: mmcauliff

text: McConnell is bringing up a #GreenNewDeal vote as a trap for Democrats. Schumer is trying to turn it into an epic self own. "Bring it on," Schumer said.
author: mmcauliff

text: Still not too excited, but nearly a full sentence
author: mmcauliff

text: And then they kiss babies
author: mmcauliff

text:
@SenWhitehouse to Republicans: "If you don't like the #GreenNewDeal, what's your plan?" 

"They stay away from this issue like the plague."
author: mmcauliff

text: I don't think I've seen @SenWhitehouse this happy on the Senate floor ever, after Schumer's #GreenNewDeal speech: "Let me sign up right now as a member of the bring it on caucus. Bring it on, indeed."
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer: I challenge leader McConnell to say that our climate crisis is real, that it is caused by humans, and Congress needs to act. (says he won't because he can't.)
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer to McConnell on bringing a vote on the #GreenNewDeal. "Bring it on."
author: mmcauliff

text: Schumer is hammering McConnell's plan to hold a #GreenNewDeal vote as a political "stunt." Feels like Dem leaders are waking up (sorry @SenWhitehouse) to the power of the climate issue.
author: mmcauliff

text:
So, @senatemajldr put this on the Senate calendar just now: 

"S. 483, a bill to enact into law a bill by reference. S.J. Res. 8 recognizing the duty of the federal government to create a Green New Deal."

#GreenNewDeal
author: mmcauliff

text: Ah. Trump berated Coons, and the next morning Coons prayed for Trump.
author: mmcauliff

text: Coons specifically prayed for President Trump, with Trump at his side, at the National Prayer Breakfast last week. I don’t know which followed which, but I know which one is a better look.
author: mmcauliff

text: NEWS: the government funding conference committee has wrapped. Text should be filed in an hour. Senate should pass tomorrow and then the House should follow by Thursday night. Then it’s all up to Trump.
author: mmcauliff

text:
missed Lloyd Dogget breathing fire on the Yemen resolution. 

“Unlawful, murderous air strikes.. with bombs made in America on schools, on hospitals, on weddings, on markets... 

Months, years, hundreds of small graves ago, this Congress should have acted.”
author: mmcauliff

text: Reps @AOC and @AyannaPressley raised the question today: Are black and brown people most harmed by the war on drugs being locked out of the booming pot industry in favor of those who profited?
author: mmcauliff

text:
@RepRashida hearing on marijuana business banking: "Does the money smell? We're talking about bags of cash."

Answer: Yes.
author: mmcauliff

text: @AyannaPressley at hearing on safe harbor bill for cannabis banking: "We can't have a situation, which is what we see playing out, where people who have been historically locked up are now locked out of a multi-billion dollar industry."
author: mmcauliff
